intro: Ilex kengii f. tiantangshanensis, commonly known as the Tiantangshan holly, is a rare and endemic plant native to China. It belongs to the family Aquifoliaceae and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, red berries. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments within mountainous regions. Its foliage is dense and glossy, making it an ornamental species in horticulture. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a conservation concern.
